meanings.sent1: The unicorn in the story was described as nonexistent.
meanings.sent2: The ghost was believed to be nonexistent by the skeptical scientist.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking tree seemed as nonexistent as a flying pig.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes of finding a magic lamp were as nonexistent as a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The chances of winning the lottery were so nonexistent that she didn't even bother buying a ticket.

meanings.sent1: The invisible cloak was so well-made that it seemed nonexistent to the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: The treasure on the map turned out to be nonexistent, much to the disappointment of the adventurers.
meanings.sent3: His excuses for being late were as nonexistent as his sense of direction.
meanings.sent4: The trust between them was so nonexistent that it felt like they were speaking different languages.
meanings.sent5: The chances of finding a four-leaf clover in a field of three-leaf clovers were practically nonexistent.
